transparency_law.name: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act
transparency_law.statute_citation: Connecticut General Statutes Title 1, Chapter 14, §§ 1-200 to 1-241

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Agencies must respond within 4 business days. The word 'promptly' means quickly and without undue delay.
extension_conditions: Agencies may establish special schedules if requests interfere with normal duties
response_requirements.no_response_consequence: Denial subject to appeal to Freedom of Information Commission

fee_structure.standard_copy_fee: $0.50 per page for non-state agencies; $0.25 per page for state agencies
fee_structure.notes: Judicial Department: $0.50 per page (first 20 pages), $0.25 per page thereafter. No fee for inspection.

exemptions.description: Personnel files and similar files the disclosure of which would constitute an invasion of personal privacy
Records of strategy sessions of a public agency or the negotiations of pending claims or litigation until finally adjudicated or settled
Records, reports and statements required to be kept confidential under provisions of the general statutes or so exempted by state or federal law
Test questions, scoring keys and other examination data used in administering licensing, employment or academic examinations
Real estate appraisals, engineering or feasibility estimates relative to property acquisition until contracts executed or proceedings abandoned
Records, reports and statements of strategy or negotiations with respect to collective bargaining
Computer programs as defined in subdivision (1) of subsection (a) of section 1-211

appeal_process.appeal_description: File with FOIC within 30 days of denial. Commission may order mediation.
appeal_process.court_jurisdiction: Superior Court for the Judicial District of Hartford
appeal_process.burden_of_proof: Public agency must prove disclosure not required

penalties.criminal: Class B misdemeanor for failing to comply with FOIC order; Class A misdemeanor for willful FOIA violations
penalties.civil: Up to $1,000 civil penalty by FOIC

requester_requirements.specific_format: Written application required for copies (not for inspection)
requester_requirements.notes: Inspection requires no written request; copies require written application

specific_obligations: Maintain records in reasonably accessible manner
Provide information on procedures for accessing records
Explain technical terms or abbreviated notations

oversight_body.name: Freedom of Information Commission
oversight_body.role: Adjudicates appeals, enforces FOIA compliance, imposes penalties

primary_sources: Connecticut Freedom of Information Commission materials
validation_metadata.verification_notes: Parsed from official statutory text file. Response time verified against canonical-values.json (4 business days).
